intro: Macrochordion triangularis, commonly known as the triangular sedge, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically green or brown in color. Macrochordion triangularis thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in marshy areas or along waterways.
